Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Bead
Description: Bead made from a black siliceous conglomerate, possibly with sand, bearing traces of a green enamelled coating. The bead is asymmetrical, bulging in the middle, and has been pierced longitudinally. According to the dig diary, it was found around the neck of a child.
